intro: Heteropterys wydleriana, commonly known as the Wydler's waxtree, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. The plant is characterized by its glossy, elliptical leaves and clusters of small, pinkish-white flowers. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. The fruit is a capsule that releases small, hairy seeds when mature.
